events.name: Special Event: Martin Rees: Exploring the Cosmos
events.description:
Special Event: Martin Rees: Exploring the Cosmos
Friday, 16 June 2017 | 5pm – 6.30pm
Expression Gallery, Level 4
Free on a first-come-first-served basis. Register on Level 4.

Astronomer Royal Martin Rees invites you to explore the cosmos, imagining its origins and what the future might hold. In his signature style mixing humour and profundity, he encourages us to use astrophysics, and science more broadly, not only to make sense of space and time, but also to question the bigger existential reasons for our being.

Programme:
5.00pm: Welcome Note by Honor Harger, Executive Director of ArtScience Museum and Jan Vasbinder, Director of Para Limes

5.05pm: Introduction by Professor Bryan Penprase, Professor of Science at Yale-NUS College

5.15pm: “Exploring the Cosmos”, Presentation by Lord Martin Rees, Cosmologist and Astrophysicist

6.10pm: Panel Discussion/ Q&A with Lord Martin Rees, Moderated by Professor Bryan Penprase

About Martin Rees:
Martin Rees is a leading astrophysicist as well as a senior figure in UK science. He has conducted influential theoretical work on subjects as diverse as black hole formation and extragalactic radio sources, and provided key evidence to contradict the Steady State theory of the evolution of the Universe. He was one of the first to predict the uneven distribution of matter in the Universe, and proposed observational tests to determine the clustering of stars and galaxies. Much of his most valuable research has focused on the end of the so-called cosmic dark ages — a period shortly after the Big Bang when the Universe was as yet without light sources. 

As Astronomer Royal and a Past President of the Royal Society, Martin Rees is a prominent scientific spokesperson and the author of seven books of popular science. After receiving a knighthood in 1992 for his services to science, he was elevated to the title of Baron Rees of Ludlow in 2005.

About Bryan Penprase:
Professor Bryan Penprase is a Professor of Science at Yale-NUS College and the inaugural Director of the Yale-NUS College Teaching and Learning Center. Professor Penprase received both a BS in Physics and an MS in Applied Physics from Stanford University in 1985, and a PhD from the University of Chicago in Astronomy and Astrophysics in 1992. He was a National Research Council NRC Postdoctoral Fellow at Caltech, a visiting Downing Fellow at Cambridge University and held a Visiting Associate appointment at Caltech. Professor Penprase was a professor at Pomona College between 1993 and 2016, and was awarded the Frank P. Brackett Professorship in 2007. During 2012-13, he was awarded an American Council on Education (ACE) fellowship at Yale University, where he advised Yale’s president on STEM education, online learning and diversity initiatives, as well as co-authored the planning document for the Yale-NUS College curriculum. He also served on the Yale Summer Bridge Program Advisory Committee, and developed a conference on The Future of Liberal Arts in India at the RRI Bangalore campus in 2014. In 2016, Professor Penprase was inducted into the National University of Singapore Teaching Academy, which advises the university on matters related to teaching and learning, faculty development and the Scholarship of Teaching and Learning. 

This programme is part of the Art and Science of Space season and co-hosted with Para Limes – Nanyang Technological University (NTU). 

**NEWS: ArtScience Museum will be opening late this night till 9pm! For ONE night only, there will be a 1-for-1 ticket offer to The Universe and Art after Martin Rees' talk until – 9pm (last ticket purchase is at 8pm). Please note that offer is only for Local and Standard tickets – Adult, Child/Senior/Student categories and the other two exhibitions are closed during the late night opening. **

events.name: First Code Academy Summer Camps Info Session
events.description:
Learn to think by learning to code.
Know more about First Code Academy's pedagogy and comprehensive roadmap designed for students as young as 5 years old.
Come join us for an Info Session! Learn more about the course content, hear from the instructors, and discover what it means for your child to learn at First Code Academy.Please feel free to let us know if you have any questions in the meantime. Contact us: hellosg@firstcodeacademy.com | 6820 2633 


Shaping Future Creators
First Code Academy is a leading education institute that teaches kids coding courses and develop curriculum for K-12 students to learn not just coding skills, but computational thinking. Our goal is to empower children and teenagers to become creative leaders in the digital era, for their future career and for driving social change.
events.location: First Code Academy, 04-13 Stamford Court, 61 Stamford Road, Singapore 178892

events.name: Future Fridays Goes to MakerFaire: Who're You Calling a Bot?
events.description:
Have you ever looked back on a decision you made and wondered, "oh! Why did I believe that?"

What if we can prevent regret by training ourselves to make better decisions? What if we can help others be more aware of the biases and pitfalls that affect our personal and national decisionmaking?

Come join other changemakers, educators and makers as we draw on our experiences in understanding our biases, identifying conflicts of interests to build the Decisionmaking Chatbot. We will be using an iterative process to build the chatbot through:
-Mapping out the conversations we want to have between the user -and the chatbot
-Researching additional resources and topic areas for the conversations
-Building the bot using publicly available software such as Dexter
-Testing the bot with diverse segments of the public
-Iterating and refining the box

*For those of you who have built a preliminary bot, please bring your laptops. If you haven't shared the link on our Slack group, please do so. If this week will be your first time joining us, please comment here so I can invite you to the Slack group so that you can try the bots. Please explore Dexter too! 

We will be debuting the chatbot at MakerFaire 2017 (22-23 July), so there will be a big audience for its launch! Come and be part of the effort to help each other be better critical thinkers.
